intro: Aegopogon gracilis, commonly known as slender goat's beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive, hairy texture. Aegopogon gracilis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed soils or along pathways.
